keyPolicies.policyDescription: Calls for a House of Commons that reflects the makeup of Great Britain - gender, ethnicity, profession and trade.
Advocates for fair voting system and criticizes the 'first past the post' system as old and unrepresentative of parties like UKIP.
Argues that with 800 Members, the House of Lords is the second largest chamber in the world and is unrepresentative, unelected and party political, needing a modern second chamber.
Disagrees with current Greenbelt review by increasing the housing in Doyle's Put and Bucks by converting over communities to 5,200 more houses.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A & E Services at Wycombe General Hospital
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Steve Baker has focused on Brexit, neglecting local issues like bringing back A&E services to Wycombe General Hospital which would be Richard Phoenix's priority.

mentions.candidate: Richard lives in High Wycombe with his wife Lizzie, daughter Holly and son Ben.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Only by the Conservatives losing a seat such as Wycombe will they look to change policy.

issues.brexitEurope: Move focus from Brexit to issues like Green Belt and Health, contrasts with Steve Baker's focus on Brexit.
issues.environment: Concerned about Green Belt, opposes housing expansion on it.
issues.governance: Calls for democratic reform in the House of Commons and the House of Lords.
issues.health: Wants to return A&E services to Wycombe General Hospital, criticizes current MP for not achieving this.

housing.content: Opposes current Greenbelt review which leads to 5,200 more houses, wants to address housing expansion in Wycombe.

images.caption: Image of Richard Phoenix with UKIP banner.
